adrFormatAddress: 807 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: American diner fare and a full bar offered in a stylish, modern atmosphere with loft-height ceilings.

originalText.text: We needed a big breakfast before driving home and this seemed like a good place to try based upon the ratings. We were very satisfied with our choice! It's not very big (I'm guessing ~60 patrons can eat at one time) and reminds you of a diner from the 70s with booths and seats at the counter. The food was freshly prepared and the portions were huge! The pancakes were fluffy, poached eggs perfectly done, home fries that had great flavor, soft French toast, and homemade spicy sausage! üòã The staff were very friendly and attentive. I will say the prices were a bit higher than I expected (with a generous tip breakfast for 3 was $100), but I definitely feel we got our money's worth!

originalText.text: The menu ranges from hearty breakfast options to burgers and desserts. We had breakfast here, and it was the best meal of our trip. Absolutely amazing! Very flavorful. The fruit was mouthwatering and very fresh. The staff exemplifies exceptional hospitality. Attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable, they make you feel right at home. They are prompt with orders and go the extra mile to ensure your dining experience is seamless. With its delightful atmosphere, exquisite cuisine, and top-notch service, it stands as a beacon of culinary excellence in the heart of New York City. It's only a short walk from the center of Times Square.

originalText.text:
had a quick visit to NYC and decided to make this the first stop for breakfast. I chose this place and had it on my Google to do list for a few weeks because of the interior design. I thought it was really nice and low to mid century modern. Definitely did not disappoint because the atmosphere inside of the diner was really cute.

The waiter that took care of us at the bar was extremely kind, very friendly and helpful. The food was pretty good. I personally wasn‚Äôt blown away by my French toast (it tasted like the grill a bit) - I thought it was a little bit high, but considering it is New York, and this was in a very touristy area I think it was fair enough. It‚Äôs a nice stop to consider for sure.

originalText.text: Amazing! Traditional yet not too typical American diner. Service was exceptional and friendly as our server quickly greeted us and food and drinks were cleared as soon as we finished, all with great attitude. Food was cooked quickly, tasted great, portions were more than adequate and the presentation was not sloppy. Traditional recipes were not just the same old, but custom ingredients were added. Stuffed french toast is a must try and so is the fresh-squeezed oj. The atmosphere was inviting and retro-like. It was a full house without a cramped feeling or sacrifice in service quality. Location was within walking distance from our hotel in Times Square. Premises appeared accessibility friendly. Price was affordable and value was great. Overall we felt welcome and appreciated.

originalText.text:
The service in the place is very good. The staff is very friendly.

We visited the place two times, we tried the veggie omelette and the chocolate chip pancakes. The veggie omelette was good and cooked well with rating of 8.5/10, but the chocolate chip pancakes were normal and didn‚Äôt like the dough texture, rating 6/10.
